front.title: Architecture for Implementing Network Single Sign-On

abstract.t: There are several different single sign-on (SSO) solutions offeredby various software vendors today. All such solutions requireapplications to be written to a vendor specific API. In view of alack of industry wide standard for SSO APIs, applicationdevelopers find it almost impossible to SSO enable theirapplications to work with any vendor solution. This documentpresents alternative SSO implementation architecture that allowsapplications to be transparently enabled for SSO. Further, itallows different SSO solutions to interoperate with relativelylittle effort.
